instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 power rails cycling
threads.message:
Testing on the bench with nothing connected to the board but power.  Can see a slight twitch on the fans at times. Was able to verify that all major power rails are pulsing but present at correct values and PLT_Reset)_L pulses also. 

Resoldered U8900 just in case. Tried new BIOS and CLeanME with no change. Liquid indicator was triggered on battery connector but board looks good - a little noticeable residue near the keyboard connector. SMC bypass gets a bit of fan spin but no start.

Thinking maybe GPU bypass, Flux and heat CPU or USC the board... Other thoughts?

threads.title: 820-3332 power rails cycling
threads.message:
Check if board turns on lifting all GPU coils.
You can also start removing ALL_SYS_PWRGD resistors, one by one; keep in place R7967.
Just in case, remove Q7950 first.

threads.title: 820-3332 power rails cycling
threads.message:
I had tried the other all_sys resistors already but forgot  about q7950. No luck with any of those or pulling the GPU coils.

I'm going to give it a bath and pray.

threads.title: 820-3332 power rails cycling
threads.message: This can be marked as solved. USC didn't change anything but being LI were triggered on battery, and my Medusa was unable to program the chip on board, I checked the SPIROM traces and discovered a missing connection from R5121 to U6100. Board now boots so should be good to go.
